p: “Bio-based products go far beyond biomass processing. They capitalize on the unprecedented advances in life sciences and biotechnology… that, coupled with the digital revolution, allow [one] to use nature’s “biological assets” (its biochemicals and biomaterials) and its “biomimetic assets” (its functions and processes) to generate significant new sources of economic value and future revenue” (EC 2018, p. 42). This citation from the revised EU bioeconomy strategy is a common example of human–nature duality where humans and nature are seen as separate from one another, with the former dominating the latter.
